DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to assessment of clot formation in blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to assessment of clot formation in blood.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:The process of clot formation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The process of clot formation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is the PT INR less than or eq
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the PT INR less than or equal to 1.5 (or an in-range INR, usually between 2 and 3, if a patient is on a stable dose of therapeutic warfarin) and the PTT less than 1.2 times the Upper Limit of Normal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the PT INR less than or equal to 1.5 (or an in-range INR, usually between 2 and 3, if a patient is on a stable dose of therapeutic warfarin for management of venous thrombosis including pulmonary thrombo-embolus) and the PTT less than 1.2 times the Upper Limit of Normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the prothrombin time such that the International Normalized Ratio (INR) is less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the PT INR less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN (or an in range INR, usually between 2 and 3, if a patient is on a stable dose of therapeutic warfarin) and the PTT less than 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: PT <= 1.5 x upper limit of normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the Prothrombin Time (PT) such that the International Normalized Ratio (INR) is less than or equal to 1.3 X ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, is the patient taking a dose of 2 mg/day or less for prophylaxis of thrombosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the patient's international normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.5 X ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prothrombin time (PT) <=1.5 x institutional normal (ULN)

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If not on Coumadin, is the patient's international normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study INR greater than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or PT greater than or equal to 1.5x upper limit of normal sec above control unless patient is currently receiving warfarin therapy for the treatment or prevention of venous thrombosis?
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study INR greater than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal or PT greater than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal seconds above control unless patient is currently receiving warfarin therapy for the treatment or prevention of venous thrombosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the INR or PT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN (or is PT or INR within therapeutic range of intended use of anticoagulants, if patient is receiving anticoagulant therapy) and the aPTT less than 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is international normalized ratio (INR) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN (or an inrange INR, usually between 2 and 3, if a patient is on a stable dose of therapeutic warfarin) and a PTT less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the INR and aPTT less than or equal to 1.5 times the ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's international normalized ratio of prothrombin time (INR) and prothrombin time (PT) <= 1.5 x ULN for the lab within 28 days before randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's PT/INR less than 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's PT/INR less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is this patient's International Normalized Ratio (INR) or Prothrombin Time (PT) less than or equal to 1.5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's PT/INR less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN within 14 days prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's international normalized ratio of prothrombin time (INR) and prothrombin time (PT) less than or equal to 1.5 x ULN for the lab within 28 days before randomization?
